name: galantine
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a cold dish made of chicken or other meat with the bones removed, that is filled with a mixture of other foods, rolled or pressed into shape, and cooked in stock (= a liquid used to add flavour to food): For the starter I had chicken and fig galantine with a spiced mango salsa. The home cook who tries to tackle a galantine might swear off cooking for good.
More examplesFewer examplesThe farm shop offers locally sourced meat, alongside sausages and galantines made by the on-site butcher.In classic cuisine, pistachios are used to garnish galantines. Forcemeat is the primary ingredient in dishes such as pâtés, terrines, galantines, and sausages.
